alert.note: Alert for Mayes; Rogers; Tulsa; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 14 at 12:23AM CDT until August 14 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 100 AM CDT FOR SOUTHERN ROGERS...SOUTHWESTERN MAYES...NORTHWESTERN WAGONER AND NORTHEASTERN TULSA COUNTIES... At 1222 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 2 miles northeast of Owasso to 2 miles southeast of Catoosa, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...90 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged or destroyed. Homes and businesses will have substantial roof and window damage. Expect extensive tree damage and power outages. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Claremore... Owasso... Skiatook... Catoosa... Verdigris... Chouteau... Inola... Tulsa International Airport... Taiwah... Tiawah... Mazie... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 227 and 257. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...90 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is an EXTREMELY DANGEROUS SITUATION with tornado like wind speeds expected. Mobile homes and high profile vehicles are especially susceptible to winds of this magnitude and may be overturned. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms have the potential to cause serious injury and significant property damage.
